definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: But claiming that you have no competition is naive.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果說你的產品沒有競爭者，那就太天真了。

sentences.english: Monsanto has been paying farmers to use its competitors' herbicides.
sentences.chinese: 孟山都倒貼農民錢去買它的競爭者的除草劑。

sentences.english: It now has two competitors and Pfizers shareLevitra can act in as little as 16 minutes compared with 30 to 60 minutes for Viagra.
The press established him as the leading contender.
sentences.chinese: 報紙公認他是主要競爭者。

sentences.english: The young girl violinist outshone all the other competitors.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴使所有的競爭者相形見絀。

sentences.english: Yet there is nothing to suggest they will not be contenders.
sentences.chinese: 但這並不意味他們不再是冠軍的有力競爭者。

sentences.english: The response to these in-roads by European competitors has been predictable.
sentences.chinese: 對歐洲競爭者的這些招數的迴應都是預料之中的。

sentences.english: Julien: Our open source competition is rather low.
sentences.chinese: 我們的開源競爭者非常少。

sentences.english: I'm happy to be a part of a team that's a contender and looking forward to playoffs.
sentences.chinese: 我是快樂是一個競爭者的隊一部份而且期望延長加賽。

sentences.english: We can't afford to fall behind our competitors.
sentences.chinese: 我們可不能落後於我們的競爭者。

sentences.english: I don't know if Mr. Green will help us aganist our rivals or not.
sentences.chinese: 我不瞭解格林先生是否會幫助我們反對我們的競爭者。

sentences.english: Morita knew that his success would come where there was no established competition.
sentences.chinese: 盛田知道他的成功來自尚未確立競爭者。

sentences.english: We are just competitors – like all the others.
sentences.chinese: 我們跟其他人一樣都只是競爭者。

sentences.english: If you do not consider accepting this price, we wish to call your attention to the fact that your competitors will do.
sentences.chinese: 若你方不準備接受此價，你們的競爭者將會接受。

sentences.english: Its export-oriented companies shattered many of their U.S. competitors.
sentences.chinese: 日本出口導向型的公司摧毀了很多美國同行業競爭者。

sentences.english: However ANZ is expected to battle bigger and cashed-up competitors for the assets.
sentences.chinese: 但是澳新銀行預計戰鬥更大，兌現後續競爭者的資產。

definition: to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
surveyor's pole/post (used for a landmark)/CL:根[gen1]/(fig.) goal/model/benchmark
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
